Title: Psiloboletinus is an independent Genus sister to Suillus
Keywords:
Larch; multi-locus molecular phylogeny; Phylloporus;
Suillaceae; taxonomy
Abstract:
The genus Psiloboletinus was proposed by Rolf Singer in
1945 based on Phylloporus lariceti, a species that associates with Larix
in the Altai Mountains of central and east Asia. However, this
classification has been controversial due to the morphological
similarity with known genera Boletinus and Fuscoboletinus. Because of
the lack of fresh material to study, the phylogenetic position of
Psiloboletinus has remained unknown since its publication. However, the
recently described species Suillus foetidus reported from northeast
China allows this issue to be re-examined and resolved. Through
morphological observations and comparison, we find that S. foetidus is a
heterotypic synonym of Ps. lariceti. Furthermore, Psiloboletinus should
be retained as an independent genus sister to Suillus based on molecular
phylogenetic evidence and morphological features.
